content.question: At the time of Pliny, Bithynia, like all Roman-controlled territory, was

choices.label: a haphazard network of trading outposts controlled by Rome
part of an empire that encompassed the entire Mediterranean Basin
a collection of disconnected city states that Rome had little power over
a defensive league of allied nations that treated an attack on one as an attack on all

content.answer: part of an empire that encompassed the entire Mediterranean Basin
